intro: Rubus jaysmithii, commonly known as Jay's blackberry, is a species of bramble native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark red to black in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
